titleStmt.title: Description of British Library, Or 2463: Perushim

availability.licence: These images and the content of British Library Or 2463: Perushim are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, British Library has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about British Library Or 2463: Perushim. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

notesStmt.note: All folios partially water-damaged and/or mutilated.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A Judeo-Arabic commentary of Japhet ben Ali on Genesis 1 and Genesis 18.

supportDesc.extent: Part I: Folios 1-9. Part II: Folios 10-103.;

layoutDesc.layout: Part I: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 19; written lines: 19; Biblical quotations with the Arabic translation is embodied. Part II: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 21; written lines: 21; Hebrew punctuation is given in red ink. Biblical quotations are provided separately in the upper part of the page, followed by translation in the lower part of the page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Part I: Oriental semi-cursive of 16th to 17th century.Part II: Oriental square and semi-cursive script of 16th to 17th century, partially punctuated.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882, folio [104v].
